citation.article-title: Chemotaxonomic characterization of a radiotolerant bacterium Arthrobacter radiotolerans: describtion of Rubrobacter radiotolerans gen nov., comb. nov.

p.s: Description of Rubrobacter Suzuki, Collins, Iijima and Komagata gen. nov.
Rubrobacter (Ru. bro. bac'ter: L. adj ruber red; M.L. n. bacter the masculine equivalent of the Gr. neut. n. bakterion a rod; M.L. masc. n. Rubrobacter red rod)
Cells grown on R agar are generally 0.8-1.0 by 1.0-4.0 μm in size.
Cells of old culture are shorter than those of younger culture.
Principal amino acid of the cell wall peptidoglycan is L-lysine (A3-α).
Menaquinone with eight isoprene units is a major respiratory quinone.
The polar lipids consist of four phospholipids (two of which possess the chromatographic mobilities of diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol), one phosphoglycolipid and an unknown.
12-Methyl branched octadecanoic acid is the predominant cellular fatty acid.
16-Methyl branched octadecanoic acid and 2-hydroxy heptadecanoic acid are also found.
The type species is R. radiotolerans (Yoshinaka, Yano and Yamaguchi) Suzuki, Collins, Iijima and Komagata comb. nov.
